result.title: TLE '16 December [Contest Announcement] [With Prizes!]
result.content:
Hello Codeforces!

--d and I would like to invite everyone to write the Trudeau Logic Evaluation (TLE) 2016 December contest. The TLE is a monthly contest series written by high school students, predominantly from Pierre Elliott Trudeau High School, Canada. The contest serves as preparation for OI-style contests such as the CCO (Canadian Computing Olympiad) and IOI (International Olympiad in Informatics). The contest will be hosted on the DMOJ platform.

The contest will consist of 6 problems, and the problem difficulty will range from Div. 2 A to Div. 1 D. Only problems 4, 5, and 6 will have pretests, and partial points (in the form of subtasks) will be awarded!

The contest window will be 24 hours long and will last from 12:00 EST, December 23, 2016 to 12:00 EST, December 24, 2016. You may start your 3 hour interval at any time during this contest window, but be wary of the hard deadline at 12:00 EST, December 24 if you want to start late!

The top 5 winners overall and the top 2 winners from Pierre Elliott Trudeau High School will each receive a free t-shirt!

For more information, visit the contest page!

We hope that you will enjoy the contest and we wish you a Merry Christmas!

EDIT 1

The contest is starting in 1 hour! Due to request(s), the time window has also been extended by 11 hours.

EDIT 2

The contest has started! The contest window is open until 11PM EST on December 24, 2016.

EDIT 3

11 hours until the contest ends! Only 1 participant has passed pretests for problems 4, 5, and 6, so prizes are still up for grabs!

EDIT 4

The contest is over and systests have been done.

Congratulations to the winners:

1.gongy

2.ladpro98

3.thomas0115

4.r3mark

5.lewin

Editorials will be out on their respective problem pages very soon.

Thanks for participating and see you next month!

EDIT 5

Editorials are up on their respective problem pages.
